paper_abstract: The two-dimensional Hamming graph H(2, n) consists of the n(2) vertices (i, j), 1 <= i, j <= n, two vertices being adjacent when they share a common coordinate. We examine random subgraphs of H(2, n) in percolation with edge probability p, in such a way that the average degree satisfies 2(n - 1)p = 1 + epsilon. Previous work [8] has shown that in the barely supercritical region n(-2/3) In(1/3) n << epsilon << 1, the largest component satisfies a law of large numbers with mean 2 epsilon n. Here we show that the second largest component has, with high probability, size bounded by 2(8)epsilon(-2) log(n(2)epsilon(3)), so that the dominant component has emerged. This result also suggests that a discrete duality principle holds, where, after removing the largest connected component in the supercritical regime, the remaining random subgraphs behave as in the subcritical regime. (C) 2009 Wiley Periodicals, Inc. Random Struct. Alg., 36, 80-89,-2010
paper_title: The Second Largest Component in the Supercritical 2D Hamming Graph
